data.description: Critically examines important issues, questions, and debates regarding intersectionality or the notion that race, gender, and sexuality, and other terrains of difference gain meaning from each other. Materials include texts, films, and other multimedia resources drawn from an array of disciplines including sociology, critical race theory, history, political theory, and cultural studies.
data.title: THEORIZING INTERSECTIONALITY

data.description: Uses an interdisciplinary framework to interrogate core assumptions, arguments, and silences in past and present black feminist thought.
data.title: BLACK FEMINISMS
